intro: Brachyglottis sciadophila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved brachyglottis, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is typically found in coastal or subalpine habitats. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often seen in rocky or sandy environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
